Keystroke stacking: N/Axautomation and xdotool can be used to generate keystrokes under X Window System, or a program can be run in a pseudoterminal to be able to control it (as with the expect tool).

Process substitution: Yes (if system supports /dev/fd/n or named pipes)

Pipes: bytes (may contain serialized objects if print -C is used) concurrent

TCP/UDP connections as streams: Yes (client and server, but only TCP)

Subshells: partial (via %@EXECSTR[] and %@EXEC[], or via SET /M, ESET /M and UNSET /M and %@MASTER[...])

TCP/UDP connections as streams: yes (via FTP, TFTP, FTPS, SFTP, HTTP, HTTPS and IFTP, client only)
